instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this board which has 2 type c ports of which only one the second port works ad charges normal. This happened after using a dongle and i noticed some sticky thing on the board which i cleaning as much as possible. Any advice? 

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
The other port stuck on 5V input?
Probably bad CD3215 chip.
Compare diode mode readings on power rails of both chips.

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message: How do the ports look are they clean? If so, I'm with 2informaticos.

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
On F3000 i get 20v and on F3010 i only have 5v...

Also C6424 and C6404 are shorted on PPBUS_G3H_SPKRL...

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
Lot of caps connected to PPBUS_G3H.
Did you remove these two and find them shorted out of board?
Post exact resistance to ground (ohm mode) at PPBUS_G3H and all big coils.

Also seems to have problem with U3200, or its area.

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
I asked about PPBUS_G3H; diode mode, not ohm scale.
If is really low value, or short; then use ohm scale.

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
48.8 ohms on L7430 ... and PPBUS_G3H_SPKRL also a lot of caps touching the ground :D

Also when plugged in on U3100 on F3000 i have 30V and on U3200 6.8v

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840-01
threads.message:
"48.8 ohms on L7430"
I repeat
"I asked about PPBUS_G3H; diode mode"

"PPBUS_G3H_SPKRL also a lot of caps touching the ground"
You have a fix with PPBUS_G3H_SPKRL.
Did you remove R6499 to be so sure is only there???
This is the reason for pending measurment asked above.

"on U3100 on F3000 i have 30V and on U3200 6.8v"
Change the battery of your multimeter and check again voltages.
